meanings.definition: Born of a noble or high-ranking family.
meanings.sent1: The wellborn princess lived in a grand castle.
meanings.sent2: The wellborn family had a long history of serving the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The wellborn knight accidentally tripped over his own sword during training.
meanings.sent4: Her wellborn manners shone like a beacon in the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The wellborn lineage of the royal family was celebrated throughout the land.

meanings.sent1: The wellborn puppy came from a line of champion show dogs.
meanings.sent2: She carried herself with the grace of a wellborn lady.
meanings.sent3: The wellborn cat refused to eat anything but gourmet food.
meanings.sent4: His wellborn instincts guided him through the treacherous forest.
meanings.sent5: The wellborn heritage of the ancient artifact was evident in its intricate design.

meanings.definition: Born into a privileged or respected social class.
meanings.sent1: The wellborn students attended the prestigious academy.
meanings.sent2: He was wellborn, but he never flaunted his status.
meanings.sent3: The wellborn family hosted a lavish garden party for their friends.
meanings.sent4: Her wellborn upbringing instilled in her a sense of responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The wellborn community rallied together to support those in need.
